intro: Coreopsis irmscheriana, commonly known as the Texas tawny coneflower, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and features yellow to orange petals with a distinctive brown or black center. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in full sun to partial shade. Coreopsis irmscheriana is well adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in prairie and open woodland habitats.
